You forgot to mention how great and fun it is to support a glorious {{champion:119}}

A friend of mine who showed me the game to begin with currently mains Draven, a good Draven is actually really fun to support too. It's a challenge since his early game is probably his weakest due to his scaling on his spinning axe, however his early game determines the rest of his game. If he gets fed early game, he stomps mid game and nobody can 1v1 him and he hit's his late game before everyone else. If he doesn't get a kill or two at least, he probably will just be there. Still, he's really fun to support when you have a good Draven.

Not to mention if you're unfortunately in the state of just "being there", then all it can take is a kill from a well used whirling death in a team fight or just picking someone out for you to cash in!  I've had many games where I was behind and quickly reclaimed the advantage that way! {{champion:119}}  Does it all with style!
Oh yeah, a good Draven with a Leona/Thresh/Blitz can be bot Nirvana for both players involved. And usually lead into a free win when Draven inevetably snowballs off of his first kill.

Does AP Syndra support work? Just asking because I wanna try her since I got her from mystery champion and too scared to take her mid

It definitely does, but you need to know how to play syndra well before you play it. She does have solid poke and decent zoning, but her cc can be hard to land. Support syndra is harder to play because YOU make the picks and (some) engages and peel well for your adc, whereas mid syndra just nukes the fuck out of people. AP Syndra support CAN do that, but a little bit later on than mid syndra. All of the supports that I mentioned in my post work well as supports, whether it's through zoning, nuking, or just trolling. People think that supports have to have cc to do well, but they completely disregard the laning phase when they say that. Being able to zone someone really hard in lane with the likes of cass ap mf lb and syndra is underrated but can do a lot to hurt the enemy adc.

Honestly, not one of these are functional as Supports in any way except MAYBE Orianna and Rammus. I would indeed rather wait another 20 minutes or just cycle rooms till I find one with a support if you're gonna play AP Shaco support, because I'd rather have a full AP Lux/Nidalee supporting me in that case.

Define functional. All of them have some forms of cc and poke as well as a devastating all in. I find it unbelievable that people would rather take a bad "meta" pick (aka a leona that is engaging at horrible times or not peeling for their adc) than someone like me who is good at off meta or "not functional" picks onto their team. While they might not know it in champ select, I do much better when I support on these champions than on most others, and I main support. 
I will say that once laning phase is over shaco as a support is weaker than say, AP lux, but shaco can assassinate an adc far better than lux can, as well as make some incredibly trolly picks and plays using his ultimate. Even though he only has one meaningful form of cc he can still be played well as a support. I got reported once on ap shaco when I went 4/0 with an afk adc by my 0/6 toplaner. What's up with that?  If I can play well in the position that I choose with the champion I choose, why tell me I shouldn't do it?
I respect your support preferences and how you wouldn't like to lane with me, but don't you ever tell someone they can't play something. It's a game, so let me have my fun.

The 'bad meta pick Leona' you describe is only bad because of how she is played, not her kit. Played correctly she would offer a ton more in teamfights (due to her passive and ability to engage) and for peeling for her adc than Shaco. 

Not to mention, some of 'off meta' supports are really just midlaners who are trying to beat the queue. No one likes having to compete with CS with their support.

Why do people always think that off meta supports steal their cs? It's annoying. I said I'm going support, so I'm still going to act like one. I will save towers from mobs of minions later on but I never try to steal my adc's farm.
I see what you mean about Leona vs shaco and I agree. But I'm a very bad Leona, and I'm a very good ap shaco.rammus/syndra/ori/ap Caitlyn etc. If you knew that, wouldn't you rather have me play one of them than Leona? I know that even if I am bad I can still be some use as Leona, but if I end up feeding on her vs going positive and getting loads of kills and assists on other champs, I think you would agree that I would be more useful with them.

Not all supports fit every team comp, or a team comp has issues.

I tend to dodge a team of four squishies if I'm playing Soraka, for instance. The team is desperate for a support, but I'm just not a good fit.

And I tend to dodge a team if they have four glass cannons in general. You need a frontline, and I'm not comfortable being the only one with defensive abilities.

:<

But hey, I'm not a complete dick. I usually just voice why I can't be part of the team (such as the Soraka+four glass cannons issue) before leaving.
